medical: EXAM: Three views of the right ankle. INDICATIONS: Pain. FINDINGS: Three views of the right ankle are obtained. There is no evidence of fractures or dislocations. No significant degenerative changes or destructive osseous lesions of the ankle are noted. There is a small plantar calcaneal spur. There is no significant surrounding soft tissue swelling. IMPRESSION: Negative right ankle.
layman:
EXAM: Three X‑ray pictures of the right ankle.  
INDICATIONS: Pain.  
FINDINGS: The three X‑rays show no broken bones or dislocations. The ankle looks normal with no major wear or bone damage. A small heel spur is present. There is no noticeable swelling around the ankle.  
IMPRESSION: The right ankle is normal.
